item.title: Jeremy Messersmith - We All Do Better When We All Do Better - Key of F
item.description:
For Educational Use. Optimized for GCEA Ukulele. Key of F: F, Bb,C7.
As performed by jeremy messersmith.
The original does not use a 7th chord and is in the Key of F. This version is in the original key, but uses a C7 chord.
The ukulele chord font matches Aquila's KIDS strings (available in bulk sets of 20 directly from Aquila) and the font is a part of Chordette for Education, available at ukefarm.com

item.title: Jeremy Messersmith - We All Do Better When We All Do Better - Key of C
item.description:
For Educational Use. Optimized for GCEA Ukulele. Key of C: C, F, G7.
As performed by jeremy messersmith.
The original does not use a 7th chord and is in the Key of F. This version has been transposed for beginner students, and uses a G7 chord.
The ukulele chord font matches Aquila's KIDS strings (available in bulk sets of 20 directly from Aquila) and the font is a part of Chordette for Education, available at ukefarm.com

item.title: Jeremy Messersmith - Everybody Gets a Kitten - Key of F
item.description:
For Educational Use. Key of F: F, Bb, Dm, C. I used the original Jeremy Messersmith recording (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TLP9f4jsq0M). Please visit jeremymessersmith.com where you can download the entire songbook of 11 Obscenely Optimistic Songs for Ukulele for free...and support him by buying the album on iTunes or Amazon.
Try jeremy's strumming pattern of all downbeats, putting an emphasis on 1, + of two , and 4...making 4/4 time feel like 123 123 12.
The ukulele chord font is Chordette for Education, available at ukefarm.com
